title: If you have these in your chat logs, don't bother posting about your ban.
body:
- F%ggot
- N%gger
- Kys

If you have any of these in your chat log then your ban is deserved and posting complaining about it is ignorance and will only embarrass you.

Sorry I just needed to get that off my chest.

Bottom line: Don't use hate speech or encourage self-harm in game or in ANY situation.

ok

We use idiot or imbecile frequently, yet autistic is what grinds your gears? All of them are terms to describe certain level of mental disability, where autistic descibes someone with slow mind and struggles of abstract generalization (according to one autistic proffessor who described herself the experience).
They don't care. They hear the word and are immediately offended for a person that they are not.

Autistic as a word shouldn't be banned. From context it should be determined whether or not it was meant as an insult. if it was, that should be punished. (this coming from someone actually on the spectrum, if the time becomes appropriate, i mention that i am in game)

Honestly yea. I have an autistic friend and he doesn't get offended in the slightest when people call things autistic. Honestly, I'll be telling a story and if someone is being stupid I might mention them as being autistic. He doesn't get upset and I don't catch myself. We just laugh. Because he isn't autistic. He's my friend and has a name tbh. In 100 words used to describe him I would not use autistic, even though he is on the spectrum. 

It's sad that it's being used as an insult, but it's kind of like 'gay.' None of my gay friends get upset when people use gay to refer to something stupid. In fact, 90% of the time they use that word it's for that definition. Again, my gay friends aren't 'gay.' They're people. Gay wouldn't be used to describe them at all because it's not their personality, it's their sexual orientation, and you aren't defined by that. 

I don't advocate it in the slightest but words kind of just... splinter off with time. If you call someone autistic, you should be punished because you're being a prick. Not because you're using a word. If you're calling yourself autistic because you missed smite, you might offend someone, but that shouldn't be punishable at all. (Example: Dammit. Report me for being autistic, I missed smite.) I wouldn't personally do that to random people, and would only joke around with that word if I knew everyone. But... it's the internet. Thick skin is a requirement. 

Words are just words and their definitions do change or add a new part to them. They don't have power in themselves. The power is in the intent.

so you complain that people misuse the word... yet say that you often use the word and don't care? I feel like your a part of the problem when you are solidifying the meaning behind the word in a negative manner

I... didn't complain that people misuse the word? It's sad when it's being used to intentionally hurt somebody. The word has nothing to do with that sentiment though. It's the intentionally hurting somebody that I condemn. The word itself is just a word.

I do use it on special occasion, when no one looks at their map, and play like lemmings. When you are silver and you feel your whole team is bronze V -100.

I understand people can have a bad game, but 4 people at the same time in the same way ? Nah no mercy.

I can imagine a couple scenarios where appealing a ban would be appropriate.

"BRB 20s, gotta get another %%%."

Because some people are British. Or, alternatively, let's say you're playing with a person named Krystal and you typo their name:

"Hey, Kys, can you please buy a sightstone?"
"*Krys"

Sure, hate speech is a no-go. But not every instance of a banned word is hate speech, which is why the appeal process exists.

Edit: lawl, the first part of my post was auto-censored. But that's sort of the point, yeah? The appeal process is there for edge cases where the rules don't do justice.

Agreed, and that's the whole point of the appeal process: To determine when somebody meant it, or when they just got flagged by accident.

Basically, if you meant insult and used hate speech, you have pretty much zero recourse. But if you were flagged by the system and weren't using hate speech, well, that's what the appeal system is for.

No, just no.

The first two are so trivial. 

Why would you even bother reporting somebody for that? 
Don't take them personally. It's not always intended to be homophobic or racist...

You think you're doing something good by reporting, but you're really just being a huge asshole to somebody. 

What good does it do? 
It's one game. It's already over by that point, and there's a great chance you'll never see that person again.

Obviously the 'kys' one crosses a line because it is HARASSMENT. You are suggesting that somebody commit suicide which I believe is actually a punishable crime, depending on the circumstances.

I only report people for HARASSMENT or TROLLING in game.

Even if the intent wasnt to be racist or homophobic  they still were racist or homophobic and therefore because they were racist or homophobic they should be punished. 
There is no case in which people should be racist or homophobic even if they don't know what those terms mean (then they shouldn't use them) and it is very insulting to those groups of people

Acceptance is what differentiates normal humans and the monsters of history (Hitler/the nazi party , IS, Rwandan genocides) and using these terms is telling these groups of people that they shouldn't exist regardless of the user`s intent

EDIT: all three come under hate speech laws of most countries so if you believe that the first two are trivial hen pick that up with your respective government

EDIT 2 : by UK law, even saying/issuing these words defines your intent as wanting to harass this[/these people/person therefore by UK law, your intent is predefined and therefore your point about intent is legally incorrect.

EDIT 3: by UK law these words do come under harassment and therefore not "trivial

EDIT 4 : in the summoners code (yes I've actually read it) it says not to be abusive and I'm pretty sure racism and homophobia comes under abusiveness

EDIT 5 : in the summoners code it dictates to lead by example, the allowance of homophobic and racist behaviour is not a good example of leading by example




BTW not a lawyer and never intend to be
